DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Engenharia Mecânica-aeronáutica pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1977), mestrado em Engenharia Aeronáutica e Mecânica pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1981) e doutorado em Engenharia Aeronáutica e Mecânica pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1989). Atualmente é professor Associado II do Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica. Tem experiência na área de Engenharia Mecânica, com ênfase em Transferência de Calor, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: elementos finitos, sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos, cfd (dinâmica de fluidos computacional), escoamento de fluidos e transferência de calor e escoamento atmosférico para aplicação em energia eólica.&#10;Desenvolveu estas atividades acadêmicas até dezembro de 2013. A partir de janeiro de 2014 em diante atua como diretor de engenharia de avaliação de recursos eólicos e solares na Casa dos Ventos Energias Renováveis.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Engenharia Mecânica-aeronáutica from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1977), master's at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1981) and ph.d. at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (1989). Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Transference of Heat, acting on the following subjects: elementos finitos, cfd, sistemas ambientais aeronáuticos, cfd (dinâmica de fluidos computacional) and escoamento interno.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Análise de Proteção Térmica por Ablação
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto, com período de execução de outubro de 2000 a setembro de 2002, teve como objetivo o desenvolvimento de um programa computacional para cálculo do fenômeno de ablação que ocorre em uma proteção térmica de um microsatélite recuperável (satélites de retorno à superfície terrestre). Foi utilizada uma abordagem entálpica considerando o problema transiente bidimensional e usando a técnica de elementos finitos com refinamento adaptativo de uma malha não-estruturada com elementos triangulares. Essa ferramenta computacional forneceu informações para o projeto e otimização da proteção térmica de veículos espaciais em condições de entrada atmosférica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Formulação simultânea: método da penalidade e equação de Poisson da pressão
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Esta proposta de pesquisa trata da solução de problemas com a formulação em variáveis primitivas (u, v, w, P).&#10;Neste projeto de pesquisa aplica-se simultaneamente o método da penalidade e a formulação de equação de Poisson da pressão para obter uma solução numérica do modelo matemático para o escoamento de um fluido incompressível (densidade constante) e também para a solução de escoamento quase-incompressível (densidade função somente da temperatura). O objetivo principal é reduzir o esforço computacional envolvido para satisfazer o princípio de conservação de massa dentro de um limite de erro pré-estabelecido, usando um programa de elementos finitos com refinamento adaptativo de malha. Como os valores do parâmetro de penalidade a serem utilizados são relativamente pequenos, não ocorre o problema de &quot;mesh locking&quot;, portanto, é desnecessária a utilização dos esquemas com integração reduzida no método da penalidade dentro do escopo desta proposta.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Análise das Tecnologias de Captura de CO2 e seus Efeitos no Desempenho das Turbinas a Gás
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: OBJETIVO&#10;O objetivo principal deste projeto de pesquisa é analisar as tecnologias para redução da emissão de CO2 em usinas térmicas devido à queima de combustíveis fósseis e investigar os seus efeitos no desempenho das turbinas a gás. Através do desenvolvimento do projeto pretende-se formar recursos humanos com conhecimento e capacitação especializados na tecnologia de turbina a gás no Brasil, em especial àquela associada com as usinas termelétricas.&#10;Pretende-se ainda desenvolver atividades de pesquisa complementares para dar continuidade à operação do Centro de Referência El Paso de Turbinas a Gás, cujo projeto de implantação foi financiado e aprovado pela Aneel.&#10;&#10;JUSTIFICATIVA&#10;A pesquisa sobre os métodos para separação, captura e utilização do CO2 se justifica pois, desde o início da Revolução Industrial, a concentração de dióxido de carbono (CO2) na atmosfera tem crescido em função, principalmente, da queima de combustíveis fósseis. O aumento da concentração de CO2 acarreta mudanças climáticas na Terra porque contribui de forma significativa para a intensificação do efeito estufa e conseqüente aumento da temperatura média da atmosfera. Devido a esses problemas, faz-se necessária a inserção de alternativas para a redução nos níveis de emissão. Em 1997, os governantes de vários países adotaram o protocolo de Kyoto, onde se comprometeram a reduzir a emissão de gases que induzem o efeito estufa no período de 2008 a 2012. Cerca de 85% dessas emissões resultam de atividades de produção e uso de energia. A partir deste documento, tornou-se uma necessidade iminente a redução significativa na emissão do setor energético em vários países. Os EUA e alguns países da Europa já possuem programas operacionais de elevação da eficiência dos equipamentos de geração de potência elétrica levando em conta seus impactos ambientais.&#10;No caso específico do Brasil, até o momento, a maior parte da energia elétrica é gerada através de usinas hidrelétricas cuja emissão

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CAPTAER - Capacitação Tecnológica e Formação de Recursos Humanos para o Setor Aeronáutico.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Neste projeto de pesquisa (Captaer), suportado pela FINEP, existem duas metas físicas associadas à implantação de dois laboratórios de Sistemas Ambientais (experimental e computacional).&#10;Este laboratório de Sistemas Ambientais Aeronáuticos tem por objetivo o desenvolvimento de métodos testados aplicados à simulação e ensaio de sistemas de controle ambiental de aviões. Devido às características dos equipamentos utilizados nos aviões, o projeto deve ser baseado na simulação dos fenômenos físicos utilizando procedimentos / ferramentas atualizadas e adequadas à complexidade dos processos envolvidos. Na parte experimental (Meta Física 3), devem ser adotados procedimentos de medida e ajustes para uma correta &#09;sintonização destes sistemas, de acordo com as normas de certificação e ensaio. Na parte computacional (Meta Física 6), além da avaliação de desempenho serão simuladas possíveis falhas nos &#09;&#09;componentes dos sistemas ambientais avaliando-se os danos causados em outros sistemas do avião, como controle, combustíveis, estrutura, risco de incêndio.&#10;Estas pesquisas visam obter os seguintes resultados:&#10;- desenvolvimento de procedimentos de projeto.&#10;- redução no tempo de desenvolvimento de produtos.&#10;- avaliação de novas alternativas tecnológicas.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PROCAD : Aerotermodinâmica de Veículos de Reentrada Atmosférica
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O Programa Nacional de Atividades Espaciais (PNAE) possui metas para a implementação do Projeto de Microgravidade, onde se pretende a criar oportunidades para a realização de experimentos em microgravidade. Um dos possíveis ambientes de microgravidade é a de satélites recuperáveis. Para a recuperação dos satélites é necessário o conhecimento nas áreas de aerotermodinâmica do processo de reentrada atmosférica e da dinâmica dos materiais a serem utilizados para a proteção térmica do satélite. Este projeto é proposto a partir da possibilidade de iteração entre as duas instituições para o desenvolvimento mútuo de pesquisa e formação de recursos humanos na área espacial, especialmente na área de reentrada atmosférica .

ORIENTACAO.TITULO-ORIENTACAO: Análise da capacidade térmica efetiva na simulação de sistema ablativo por sublimação

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente trabalho será realizado em um contexto de um programa de pós-graduação conjunto para formar novos profissionais de ensino e pesquisa com uma completa compreensão da complexidade envolvida no projeto de turbomáquinas, cujo desempenho é decorrente de como os escoamentos se processam nessas máquinas.&#10;&#10;A análise da transferência de calor em turbomáquinas é de fundamental importância para o seu projeto. Isto é ainda mais relevante para o projeto e otimização de turbinas a gás (TG) de alta temperatura. Altas temperaturas na entrada da turbina (saída da câmara de combustão) viabilizam alta eficiência térmica e também alta potência específica. As altas temperaturas de entrada da turbina e o resfriamento de suas partes mais aquecidas afeta fortemente o desempenho de turbojatos, turbofans, turboprops e turbinas a gás para aplicações industriais e em termelétricas. Os materiais atualmente utilizados não suportam temperaturas acima de 1300 K, mas a máxima temperatura do fluido de trabalho no ciclo pode ser aumentada pelo resfriamento. Portanto, os componentes resfriados (revestimento da câmara de combustão, pás e paredes, bocais de exaustão, discos, etc) são amplamente usados na indústria de turbinas a gás. A incorporação do resfriamento e melhoria dos materiais resultou em um aumento de entrada da turbina de mais de 750 K desde 1960. Assim, a temperatura de entrada da turbina em TG avançadas tem aumentado em uma taxa média de 20 K/ano e pelo menos metade deste aumento foi viabilizado pelas melhorias nos mecanismos de resfriamento dos componentes das turbinas. Associado a este aumento de desempenho descrito acima, existem complexidades mecânicas, aerodinâmicas e termodinâmicas ligadas ao projeto e análise dos furos e passagens para o resfriamento. Além disso, a sangria de ar de alta pressão e o método de resfriamento causam redução na eficiência térmica. Mesmo assim, as vantagens do resfriamento superam as desvantagens tanto em turbinas a gás para aplicações aeroes

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto Inovação Tecnológica de Aplicações Avançadas de Mecânica dos Fluidos Computacional para Aeronaves de Alto Desempenho - Pacote A8 Jatos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: OBJETIVO:&#10;Aprimoramento de metodologias aplicadas à dinâmica dos fluidos computacional (CFD). &#10;Resultado esperado: aquisição de conhecimento na utilização da dinâmica dos fluidos computacional para simulação de jatos (jatos impingentes, jatos drenados e estouro de bleed).&#10;Desenvolver um procedimento para obtenção de correlações aplicadas a jatos incidentes.&#10;Resultado esperado: determinação de correlações que possam ser utilizadas como ferramenta para o cálculo do jato utilizado no sistema proteção contra gelo utilizando CFD.&#10;Desenvolver modelos de trajetórias para jatos drenados.&#10;Resultado esperado: determinação de trajetórias de líquidos drenados em aeronaves através de CFD.&#10;Análise do escoamento transiente resultante do rompimento do duto de bleed.&#10;Resultado esperado: analisar o comportamento do escoamento do jato resultante do rompimento da tubulação do sistema pneumático (bleed) de uma aeronave via CFD.&#10;JUSTIFICATIVA:&#10;A utilização cada vez mais intensa de metodologias e ferramentas de simulação é um dos pontos-chave para o sucesso das equipes de engenheiros envolvidos nos processos de desenvolvimento de produtos, em particular para a indústria aeroespacial.&#10;De forma complementar a outros métodos de análise, tais como técnicas experimentais ou ensaios em vôo, as técnicas de CFD ganharam importância estratégica para a indústria aeroespacial ao longo das últimas décadas. As razões para essa importância, motivação principal da presente proposta, podem ser sumarizadas nos seguintes tópicos:&#10;(a)&#09;Baixo custo relativo das técnicas de CFD.&#10;(b)&#09;Alta versatilidade, tanto quanto a configuração geométrica quanto a diferentes condições de escoamento.&#10;(c)&#09;Viabilidade prática de aplicação iterativa durante o processo de desenvolvimento de aeronaves, simultaneamente a outras disciplinas.&#10;(d)&#09;Elevada visibilidade (a baixo custo) dos fenômenos governantes, permitindo alcançar um nível profundo de conhecimento das relações de causa e efeito envolvidas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo:&#10;Neste trabalho apresenta-se uma metodologia de&#10;cálculo para se determinar a vazão de ar na válvula de&#10;exaustão de um avião típico, conforme esquematizado&#10; O ar é insuflado com uma vazão em volume&#10;constante pelo sistema de ar condicionado na parte&#10;superior ao longo de toda a extensão da cabine, e a&#10;seguir é direcionado para a parte inferior (abaixo do&#10;piso) do avião, sendo que a exaustão ocorre na válvula&#10;de saída. Os resultados se mostraram altamente dependentes de uma&#10;avaliação da vazão de vazamento na cabine, a qual está&#10;relacionada com a razão de pressão entre a pressão&#10;externa e interna e também com a densidade do ar no&#10;interior da cabine.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: THE VALIDITY OF A ONE-DIMENSIONAL APPROACH TO THE TWO-DIMENSIONAL ABLATION PHENOMENON SIMULATION

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do IV ICHMT

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT&#10;Numerical investigations were performed to predict&#10;the relationship between the results for ablative&#10;thermal protection of a reentry satellite obtained with&#10;one-dimensional and two-dimensional approach. An&#10;enthalpy approach was implemented in a&#10;computational program where the numerical solution&#10;was obtained using the Galerkin finite element&#10;method, in order to capture the ablation latent heat&#10;effect on the thermal protection surface consumption.&#10;It is concluded that for the analyzed two-dimensional&#10;geometry, the one-dimensional approach can be&#10;employed.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do X ENCONTRO DE INICIACAO CIENTIFICA E POS-GRADUAÇÃO DO ITA

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD-Rom&#10;&#09;&#09;&#10;Abstract:&#10; One of the approaches for mitigating potential global climate change due to anthropogenic emissions of CO2 and other&#10;greenhouse gases is to capture CO2 from fossil fuels (as coal and natural gas). This emission is primarily due to the energy&#10;supplies, including the thermal power plants. At this context, this work presents a survey on the carbon dioxide capture technologies&#10;from the power plants flue gases. Both post and pre-combustion technologies are described. Results provided in the literature show&#10;that the implementation of carbon dioxide capture process has a significant impact in the power plants: efficiency reduction and&#10;costs elevation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Thermodynamic Study of an Aircraft Air-Conditioning Air Cycle Machine.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the CONEM 2004

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD-Rom&#10;&#09;&#09;&#10;Abstract. &#10;At this work a thermodynamic study of an air-conditioning aircraft air cycle machine&#09;&#10;(ACM) is performed. This ACM configuration includes mainly two compact heat exchangers, a&#09;&#09;&#10;compressor and an expander. The energy to drive this machine comes from the compressed air&#09;&#09;&#10;bleed from the compressor of the aircraft propulsion turbine. Some design features that affect the&#10;ACM performance will be studied in this work: aircraft Mach number, cabin altitude, cabin&#10;temperature and the percentage of the turbine work absorbed by the exhaust fan. Results obtained&#10;shows that the implemented computational tool that solves the ACM mathematical model allows an&#10;understanding of the ACM performance when flight aircraft and cabin human comfort parameters&#10;are changed to attain an optimized ECS configuration design.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Análise Bidimensional da Proteção Térmica por Ablação.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the III NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD_Rom&#10;&#09;&#09;&#10;Resumo: &#10;Este trabalho reporta uma análise de proteção térmica por ablação utilizando uma abordagem&#10;entálpica para mudança de fase em problemas bidimensionais. Na solução numérica deste problema, a&#10;discretização no espaço foi feita utilizando-se o método de elementos finitos de Galerkin com um&#10;procedimento totalmente implícito e iterativo no tempo, para capturar o efeito do calor latente de&#10;ablação durante o desgaste da superfície da proteção térmica. Por fim, os resultados obtidos foram&#10;comparados com a literatura específica, onde foi verificada uma boa concordância.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: ENCIT 2004

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;Commercial aircrafts must have a fire suppression system in the cargo compartment to satisfy the safety and certification requirements. These fire extinguishing systems are based on a gas discharge that performs a physicochemical inhibition of the combustion reaction. Most system uses halon 1301 as the fire extinguishing agent which is stored in liquid phase within one or two bottles. As the fire is detected, the fire suppressant agent is discharged in the cargo compartment with a Halon volumetric concentration higher than 5 % for fire knockdown in the initial stage. In the next stage, the halon volumetric concentration should be maintained above the inerting level (3 %). At this work, the mathematical model of the halon volumetric concentration was obtained applying the lumped parameter approach and the differential equation system is solved using a fourth-order Runge-Kutta scheme. This methodology allows determining the transient behavior of the following parameters: halon volumetric concentration, halon and air masses and the cargo compartment pressure. This numerical simulation provides a reliable tool to predict the fire extinguishing system behavior and to adjust the design parameters to satisfy the certification requirements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: HEAT TRANSFER ANALYSIS OF AN AIRCRAFT CABIN THERMAL TRANSIENT

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;This paper develops a mathematical model to calculate the heat transfer coefficients involved in the transient thermal analysis of a passenger's cabin using the lumped parameters method. The thermal load conditions had been analyzed for the aircraft in ground. The heat transfer coefficients were evaluated by one-dimensional thermal resistances approach and the heat exchange areas were determined for a typical short-range commercial aircrafts data. The heat transfer problem was divided in some elements: cabin floor, luggage compartment, seats, upper and lower fuselages and airflow inside the cabin. The time-dependent temperature behavior in each component was represented by an ordinary differential equation, resulting in system that was solved by iterative methods. Results allow to foreseen the time to begin the operation of the aircraft air conditioning system before the passengers boarding to satisfy the client comfort requirements. Comparing the results against the experimental data of a commercial aircraft, it is verified that the proposed model is consistent and is a good tool for aircraft air-conditioning design.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD-Rom&#10;&#10;Resumo.&#10; Este trabalho apresenta o efeito do número de pontos da quadratura de Gauss na análise numérica da proteção térmica por&#10;ablação utilizando uma abordagem entálpica para mudança de fase em problemas bidimensionais. Na solução numérica deste&#10;problema, a discretização no espaço foi feita utilizando-se o método de elementos finitos de Galerkin com um procedimento&#10;totalmente implícito e iterativo no tempo, para capturar o efeito do calor latente de ablação durante o desgaste da superfície da&#10;proteção térmica. Por fim, os resultados obtidos foram comparados com a literatura específica, onde foi verificada uma boa&#10;concordância.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD-Rom&#10;&#10;Abstract. &#10;In this paper we present the formulation,validation,and application of a hp discontinuous&#10;Galerkin methods to the numerical solution of the Navier Stokes equations governing&#10;two-dimensional stationary incompressible ows. Applying a stream function formulation we&#10;reduce the system of Navier-Stokes equations to one non-linear biharmonic equation. We linearize&#10;that equation by Picard's iterations method and then we solve the resulting linear problem&#10;using a combination of the non-symmetric discontinuous Galerkin nite element method for&#10;elliptic part of equation and discontinuous Galerkin nite element method with a jump-penalty&#10;terms for the hyperbolic part of problem. Numerical examples are shown to demonstrate the&#10;accuracy and resolution of the methods.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: TRANSFERÊNCIA DE CALOR NÃO LINEAR BIDIMENSIONAL EM CORPOS COM PROTEÇÃO TÉRMICA ABLATIVA

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Publicado em CD-Rom&#10;&#10;Resumo. &#10;Ablação é um processo com várias aplicações na engenharia principalmente no campo da indústria aeroespacial. Como proteção térmica da estrutura dos veículos espaciais que estão submetidos a altas temperaturas devido ao aquecimento aerodinâmico. O uso de materiais convencionais seria bastante restrito, pois sofreriam falhas catastróficas devido a degradação térmica de sua estrutura. Entretanto estes materiais poderão servir para os seus propósitos desde&#10;que estejam protegidos pelos conhecidos materiais ablativos. A proteção térmica ablativa consiste na aplicação de materiais especiais externamente na superfície da estrutura, isolando-a dos efeitos térmicos e garantindo uma reentrada segura dos veículos espaciais na atmosfera. O fenômeno ablativo é complexo podendo envolver perda total ou parcial de material que é sacrificado para absorção de energia, controlando a temperatura da superfície. A análise do processo ablativo em&#10;um corpo rombudo com geometria de revolução tem sido realizada na região do ponto de estagnação que pode ser simplificado como um problema de transferência de calor bidimensional com movimento de fronteira. Nesse trabalho a Técnica da Transformada Integral Generalizada (TTIG) é empregada para solução do sistema não linear de equações diferenciais parciais acopladas. A solução do problema é obtida pela transformação do sistema de equações diferenciais parciais não linear em um sistema de equações diferenciais ordinárias de primeira ordem acopladas e então resolvidas pelas conhecidas rotinas numéricas. A superfície externa do domínio&#10;está sujeito a um fluxo de calor transiente prescrito. Os resultados de interesse tais como o tempo de ablação e perda total de material ablativo são apresentados e comparados com os disponíveis na literatura.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The turbulent flow over backward-facing step has important characteristics like several&#10;engineering practical flows: diffusers, airfoils with separation, buildings, combustors and turbines&#10;blades. The detachment line of the backward-facing step flow is straight and fixed at the step edge.&#10;There is only one separated flow zone with two opposing eddies. Significant upstream effect&#10;propagation occurs only downstream the separation line. This flow is important to supply data&#10;which can be used to test turbulence models, wall laws and their implementation in computer codes.&#10;In this work, the mathematical model equations (mass conservation, momentum and turbulence&#10;models) were solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach. The results obtained&#10;show the influence of k-å turbulence models and of wall laws on the corner eddy extension and&#10;reattachment length values.&#10;Keywords: Numerical Simulation, Backward-Facing Step; k-å turbulence models.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: THE INFLUENCE OF THE TOP WALL DEFLECTION ANGLE IN THE FLOWFIELD OVER A BACKWARD-FACING STEP

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The turbulent backward-facing step flow has been investigated due to its important&#10;application which as: diffusers, airfoils with separation, buildings, combustors and turbines&#10;blades. Several previous studies have simulated features of the reattachment point under&#10;different pressure gradient values imposed by the variation of the top wall deflection angle. In&#10;this work, this problem is numerically studied using the Realizable k-å model and compared&#10;with experimental and numerical data. The wall treatment employed is the enhanced wall&#10;function. The mathematical model equations (mass conservation, momentum and turbulence&#10;model) were solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach using a&#10;commercial code. A mesh refinement procedure is performed to satisfy the grid independence&#10;requirement. Numerical results obtained show that the reattachment point is influenced by the&#10;top wall deflection angle exhibiting a small deviation (below 3%) relative to the experimental&#10;values. It is also showed that a better agreement is obtained to a denser mesh as the top wall&#10;deflection angle is larger.&#10;Keywords: Numerical Simulation, Backward-Facing Step; k-å turbulence model; top wall&#10;deflection angle.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL STUDY OF THE 2D SLOT JET IMPINGING IN CONCAVE SURFACE

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 4th NATIONAL CONGRESS OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERING

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Impingement jet heat transfer has been well established as an effective technique for heating, cooling or drying a target surface and has a variety of engineering applications. In the impingement jet cooling onto the turbine blade inner surface, the curvature effect should be taken into consideration to understand the different phenomena between the flat plate case and the curved impinging surface case. At this work, a numerical study applying the segregated control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer field of a jet impinging normally on the concave surface. The problem considered is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) of a two-dimensional laminar slot jet with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 and nozzle-to-surface spacing range 0.5 to 10. The effect of nozzle-to-surface spacing on the flow and heat transfer is investigated. To validate the concave surface numerical results, a comparison with literature available data obtained for flat plate is firstly performed. It is verified that the Nusselt number obtained for the concave surface case is larger than the flat plate configuration in the stagnation region of the 2D slot impinging jet.&#10;&#10;Keywords: impingement jet, concave surface, slot jet, finite volume method.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL STUDY OF THE PULTRUSION PROCESS USING ELLIPTIC AND PARABOLIC APPROACHES BASED ON PECLET NUMBER

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Pultrusion is one of the manufacturing processes which are used for continuous fabrication of fiber-reinforced polymer composites of constant cross-section. In this process, dry fibrous reinforcement is pulled through a resin bath for resin impregnation. Over the years, these materials have found increasingly wide applications in a variety of industries including the aerospace, building, and electronics, once this materials have important characteristic such as high strength and stiffness to weight ratio, resistance to environmental deterioration, high electrical insulation. The pultrusion process can be understood as an advection-reaction-diffusion problem modeled by two partial differential equations: energy and a degree of cure transport equations. These equations are coupled by a reactive source-term from the resin curing exothermic reaction. At this work, it was analyzed two different approaches (elliptic and parabolic models) for the pultrusion process simulation. The results showed good agreement with experimental data and elliptic and parabolic models presented similar predictions of the temperature and degree of cure profiles to higher Peclet number values.&#10;&#10;Keywords. Pultrusion, Finite Element Method, Elliptic Approach, Parabolic Approach

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NEVES JUNIOR, João Batista Do Porto
ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This work focuses on a numerical simulation of a fire suppression system in an aircraft cargo compartment, using the halon 1301 (CBrF3) as the fire extinguishing agent. A simple formulation is implemented based on the lumped parameter method to obtain a mathematical model of the problem and a time evolution of the air and halon volumetric concentrations. The resulting differential ordinary equations system is solved using a computational tool with an easy graphical interface and the solution uses a fourth order Runge-Kutta scheme. The developed numerical tool is used to verify the influence of different parameters on the fire suppression system design as: flight altitude, cabin temperature, cabin volume, fuselage leakage area and the air infiltration rate. Numerical and experimental results showed a good agreement for the halon volumetric concentration inside the cargo compartment and satisfy the certification requirements. It is concluded that the model developed in the present work is an important tool to be used in the preliminary analysis during the aircraft conceptual design stage or to modify a pre-existent fire extinguishing system. &#10;&#10;Keywords: fire suppression, lumped parameter method, numerical simulation

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Impinging jets are widely used for heating, cooling and drying applications. The jets are generally issued from a nozzle with a circular sections or rectangular slots and accordingly identified as circular jet and slot jet, respectively. In this work, numerical simulations were performed applying the control volume scheme to analyze the flow and heat transfer fields of a jet impinging normally on flat surface. The problem analyzed is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) of an axisymmetrical circular turbulent jet with Reynolds number equal to 23,000. The turbulence models used were Standard k- , Spalart-Allmaras and V2F models implemented in commercial CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics) software. A comparison of the turbulent viscosity results using these three different turbulence models is also shown. To validate the flat plate numerical results, a comparison with available data obtained in the literature is carried out. For the Standard k- turbulence model, two different boundary conditions in the inlet (uniform and power law profiles) were simulated. It is verified that k- model results overpredict the values quantities in comparison with the Spalart-Allmaras and V2F models results.&#10;&#10;Keywords: Impingement jets, CFD, Turbulence models, Finite volume method.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of Cabling Effects in the Temperature Distribution in Electronic Devices Rack

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 11th BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;The target of this work is to evaluate the effect of the cables in the temperature distribution inside electronic equipment of aircraft&#10;racks using CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamic) tool. The cables (wiring) are modeled as a porous media and the continuity,&#10;momentum, energy equations are numerically solved in conjunction with the standard k-epsilon turbulence model. The finite volume&#10;method with a segretated formulation is employed to solve the mathematical model. Four different cases are simulated: the standard&#10;case without wiring and with air ventilation shows the baseline airflow and temperature distributions; the second case without&#10;ventilation and without wiring indicates that the effect of the natural convection is important; in the third case with constant velocity&#10;input, the effect of the porous media is verified through the calculation with several source terms showing that the pressure increase&#10;does not affect the temperature distribution; in the last case (constant pressure boundary condition with wiring) several source terms&#10;are used and are verified that the velocity magnitude increase in the entry affects significantly the temperature distribution of the&#10;components. Each imposed equipment heat flux is evaluated from the experimental temperature results. Numerical average&#10;equipment temperature results exhibit an asymptotic behavior as a function of the input airflow velocity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Numerical Study of the Pultrusion Process with Variable Thermal Properties

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 11th BRAZILIAN CONGRESS OF THERMAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;Pultrusion process has gained significance as a composite manufacturing method over the past few years. It is a continuous&#10;process for composite materials with constant cross-sections with a high productivity and cost-effective. Pultrusion of thermosetting&#10;matrices consists of two phases, namely impregnation and curing. At first, a fiber creel passes through a resin bath. The fiber&#10;impregnated with liquid resin enters a heated die where the elevated temperature induces the curing resin process. Then, the&#10;pultruded bar is pulled through the die with a constant speed. The pulling speed, the die temperature, the fiber volume fraction and&#10;the thermal properties are important parameters that must be set carefully to obtain a high quality of the final product. At the present&#10;work, the carbon/Epoxy system has been simulated with a three-dimensional parabolic model employing the finite element method&#10;using thermal properties as a function both of temperature and degree of cure distributions inside the pultruded rectangular bar and&#10;making comparison with the assumption of to use constants average thermal properties. Evaluating of both the degree of cure and&#10;temperature profiles in different conditions for die-wall set-point temperature was also performed. Results showed that the degree of&#10;cure development is delayed for the variables properties case, requiring a larger die length to reach a suitable design value of the&#10;degree of cure and cure and temperature's positions in the die is important for to increase the rate degree of cure.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Análise termodinâmica de máquinas de ciclo a ar para aplicação aeronáutica

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo&#10;Atualmente, as máquinas de ar condicionado para aplicação aeronáutica utilizam ciclos a ar devido às penalidades relacionadas com peso e volume ocupado. O presente trabalho trata de modelos termodinâmicos de máquinas de ar condicionado ciclo a ar de 3 e 4 rotores aplicadas em aeronaves. Avaliam-se as condições de operação tanto em cruzeiro como em solo, mostrando que o segundo estágio de expansão da máquina 4 rotores provoca um aumento na eficiência termodinâmica do ciclo. Conclui-se que a análise termodinâmica dos ciclos das máquinas de ar condicionado é importante para análise de alternativas durante a fase de anteprojeto.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;This numerical study reports the coupled conduction and natural convection heat&#10;transfer in a discretely heated cavity. The cavity has three protuberant discrete heat sources,&#10;equally space, mounted to one vertical wall. The conduction in the solid (protuberant heat&#10;sources) and the convection in the fluid region are solved using a unique domain by a&#10;coupled way (conjugate problem). The governing steady-state partial differential equations&#10;system is solved applying the segregated finite volume method with an unstructured mesh.&#10;The effects of the solid to fluid conductivity ratio and geometric aspect ratio on the velocity&#10;and temperature profiles were analyzed. Furthermore, results showed that when the&#10;geometric aspect ratio is reduced, more than one recirculation zones appear.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;In the present study axisymmetric compressible turbulent free jet problem is&#10;numerically solved. Governing equations are discretized employing the volume finite&#10;method with second order discretization approach. Different turbulence models were&#10;tested using the CFD software Fluent to determine the most suitable model for the&#10;compressible overexpanded turbulent free jet problem. Jet flow conditions were: fully&#10;overexpanded at Mach number 2 and total temperature equal to 677.37K. Computational&#10;results for Mach number, total temperature contours, shock structures were compared&#10;with available experimental data. Results obtained from this investigation indicate that the&#10;k-&#969; SST turbulence model produced better overall results.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;Numerical simulations of the three-dimensional flow over a backward-facing&#10;step channel are reported in order to investigate the flow characteristics and threedimensional&#10;effects. Results are presented for laminar air flow for Reynolds number lower&#10;than 1,095. The mathematical model equations (mass conservation and momentum) were&#10;solved with finite volume technique and a segregated approach. A mesh refinement study&#10;is performed to attain the grid independence requirement. Results obtained are compared&#10;to experimental data presenting a good agreement. The numerical results of this work&#10;show a non-linear increase of the reattachment length as also evidenced by the&#10;experimental results extracted from literature.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: In this work the influence of the numeric solution techniques has been evaluated on the laminar jet impinging on a hot surface. The effect of solver type, mesh and interpolation schema on Nusselt number has been addressed. The problem considered is air flow (Pr = 0.71) of a round jet impinging onto a hot plate with Reynolds number ranging from 10 to 1,000. A parametric study is performed on triangular and quadrilateral meshes in a variety of mesh densities and considering four interpolations schemas for momentum equations. Moreover, the differences between segregated and coupled solvers for Finite Volume Method are discussed. The results show that the higher is the Reynolds number the higher is the difference between the Nusselt number given by triangular and quadrilateral meshes. The requirements in terms of mesh density to reach mesh independence are lower in the coupled solver than in the segregated one.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL STUDY OF HEAT TRANSFER IN A TURBULENT JET DISCHARGING INTO A CROSS-FLOW

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Turbulent jets flows discharging into a crossflow are encountered in a variety of applications including pollutant discharges, drying of paper, textiles, combustion chamber design, film cooling of turbine blades and aircraft fluid discharges. The heat transfer and flow characteristics of the jet discharge into a crossflow are complex due to the inherent interactions becoming a good test to turbulence models. The main characteristics of the single jet discharging into a cross-flow are the formation of the counter-rotating bound vortex pair downstream from the jet exit, a horseshoe vortex system in the cross-flow boundary layer upstream from the jet exit, and the creation of wake vortices similar in appearance to those observed in the flow past a bluff body. This wake flow reattaches the jet emerging wall in a downstream distance depending on the jet to crossflow velocity ratio. In the present work, governing equations (mass conservation, momentum, energy and standard k-&#61541; turbulence model) are discretized using a finite volume approach with a hexahedrical structured mesh to simulate this problem. The pressure and velocity fields are coupled employing the SIMPLE algorithm. Due to the importance for aeronautical applications, present numerical analysis is focused on the influence of the jet to crossflow velocity ratio on the temperature distribution along the reattachment region at the duct wall.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF THE SMOKE TRANSPORT INSIDE AN AIRCRAFT CARGO COMPARTMENT USING A PASSIVE SCALAR APPROACH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. The smoke transport due to a fire should be well understood for designing practical smoke management system. Current regulations require that aircraft cargo compartment smoke detectors alarm within one minute of the start of a fire and at a time before the fire has substantially decreased the structural integrity of the airplane. Presently, in-flight tests, which can be costly and time consuming, are required to demonstrate compliance with the regulations. This paper presents a CFD model for smoke dissipation inside the 707 cargo compartment in fire condition. The model can provide information on smoke transport under various conditions. It is also fast running, allowing for simulation of numerous fire scenarios in a short period of time. The conservation equations of heat, mass and momentum transfer were solved using the FLUENT software with a passive scalar approach to model the smoke (CO,CO2 and soot) transport. In order to validate the whole procedure, the results of the simulations with FLUENT are compared with experimental data and the results of a CFD code developed by Sandia National Laboratories. Temperature profiles along the ceiling cargo compartment and smoke concentration are also obtained. It is shown that the proposed method should be useful for designing a smoke management system and the CFD smoke transport model presented has the potential to satisfy the certification process.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;Impingement jets have been widely used in several engineering applications to heat and/or cool surfaces.&#10;Some practical examples include: paper drying, cooling of electrical equipments, tempering and shaping of glass,&#10;annealing of metal and plastic sheets, cooling of high-temperature gas turbine blades. In aviation, impingement jets&#10;are used in anti-icing systems on leading edge of aircraft wing. Such anti-icing systems use hot air educed from the&#10;motor compressor (bleed air). In this work, the important parameters to build a correlation that represents the&#10;compressible flow with heat transfer in internal concave curved surfaces of the aircraft wing leading edge were&#10;identified using a dimensional analysis. In the literature survey were found many correlations used to evaluate the heat&#10;transfer rate of impingement jet flow in aircraft thermal anti-icing systems, thereby the correlations proposed in the&#10;revised works were developed for heat transfer problems geometrically not similar to the anti-icing system and only&#10;one carried on the compressibility effect (Mach number).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;Free jets have been of great interest for many engineering applications as in aerodynamic, thermal, chemical and&#10;propulsion systems. In the present study axisymmetric compressible turbulent free jet problem is numerically solved. Governing equations (mass conservation, momentum, energy and turbulence model) are discretized employing the volume finite method with a segregated solver and second order discretization approach. Two different turbulence models were tested Spalart-Allmaras and v2-f using the a CFD tool to determine the most suitable model for the compressible free jet problem. Jet flow conditions were: Mach number 0.6, Reynolds 1.7e6 and total temperature at nozzle exit 316 K. Computational results for decay velocity for each simulated case were compared with available experimental data. Results obtained from this investigation indicate that the v2-f&#10;turbulence model produced better overall results.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;Impingement jet heat transfer has been well established as an effective technique for heating, cooling or&#10;drying a target surface and is employed in many important applications. At this work, a numerical study applying the control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer of a impingement jet normal to a flat surface. The convective terms were discretized using differents interpolation schemas to study the influence on local Nusselt number in the impingement wall. The discretized equations were solved by a segregated formulation using the SIMPLE approach for the pressure-velocity coupling. The problem considered is of a circular jet laminar air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 with constant nozzle-to-surface spacing of the H/D = 2. An unstructured mesh with quadrilateral elements were employed to obtain the numerical solution. The influence of radial domain extension in the results is also analyzed for r/D = 2.5, 5, 7.5 and 10. To validate the results, a comparison with available literature data is performed. The results shows that the interpolation schema and the radial domain extension dont affect the Nusselt number in the studied parameters range.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;The main objective of this report is the development of aeronautic air conditioning system thermodynamic&#10;models of 3 and 4-wheel air cycle machines, aiming to understand the main thermodynamic advantages and&#10;disadvantages of each configuration. The EES  Equation Engineering Solver is used to develop the models, some&#10;parametric analysis and the graphic outputs. Ones intention also is to evaluate the impacts of the re-heaters and&#10;condensers in the system efficiency. The thermodynamic models are tested under ground and flight operational&#10;conditions. Results showed that the second level of expansion from 4-wheel air cycle machine increases the&#10;thermodynamic efficiency of the cycle, and this effect was more evident for ground operation conditions. In addition, it was observed that the presence of a condenser decreases the coefficient of performance of both air cycle machines discussed, which is related to the fact that lines of constant pressure on a T-s diagram diverge with increasing entropy. Ones concluded that the application of the software EES for thermodynamic analysis of air cycle machines can be really useful for advanced design analysis, mainly because it helps in understanding the thermodynamic process considered.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;This work focuses on a numerical simulation of a fire suppression system in an aircraft cargo compartment,&#10;that uses the halon 131 (CBrF3) as the fire extinguishing agent. The Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) tool has&#10;been used to analyze a time-space evolution of the halon volumetric concentration that is the main requirememt in the certification process. This mathematical model also allows to verify the influence of different parameters as infiltration rate and mixture leakage rate on the fire suppression system design. A mesh has been generated involving the cargo compartment domain to solve the governing differential equations. Numerical and experimental results showed a good agreement for the halon volumetric concentration inside the cargo compartment and satisfying the certification requirements. It is concluded that the model developed in the present work is an important tool to be used in the preliminary analysis during the aircraft conceptual design stage or to modify a pre-existent fire extinguishing system.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;Pressure loss in ductworks is an important factor to be considered in design of engineering systems such as power-plants, refineries, HVAC systems to reduce energy costs. Ductwork can be composed by straight ducts and different types of fittings. Duct fittings are significant sources of pressure loss in fluid distribution systems. Fitting losses can be even more significant than equipment components such as coils, filters, and dampers. At the present work, a 90o round elbow under turbulent incompressible airflow is studied. Mass, momentum energy and k-Õ turbulence model equations are solved employing the finite volume method. The SIMPLE algorithm is used for the pressure-velocity coupling. In order to validate the numerical tool, the elbow pressure loss coefficient is determined using the same conditions to obtain the ASHRAE database. Furthermore, the effect of Reynolds number variation on the elbow pressure loss coefficient is investigated. These results can be useful to perform better preliminary design of air distribution system in aircraft air conditioning.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;Nowadays, thermal control of electronics equipment design is a hard work due to increase in power and size reduction that implies in a large increase in heat flux. In this paper, a conjugate heat transfer analysis (convective + conductive) of a plate fin heat sink with confined impingement cooling is accomplished to verify the influence of Reynolds number in dissipator performance. The mathematical model equations (continuity, momentum, energy and turbulence model) were numerically solved using finite volume method and compared with experimental results. To reduce numerical errors, an interface conformal mesh is used to improve boundary normal gradient evaluation. The obtained numerical results showed a good agreement with experimental data for small Reynolds numbers. Differences&#10;between these values increases with Reynolds number. Like experimental results, numerical values of heat sink thermal resistance decreases when Reynolds number increases, showing that the electronic component works with lower junction temperature for larger Reynolds number.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;Jet impingement cooling has been widely used to cool elements exposed to high temperature and high heat flux environments because of its advantages in the effective removal of locally concentrated heat. At this work, a numerical study applying the 3D control volume numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the flow and heat transfer characteristics of a laminar circular jet impinging normally on a flat surface. The problem considered is air flow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) with Reynolds number ranging from 100 to 1000 and constant nozzle-to-surface spacing of the H/D = 2. An unstructured mesh with hexahedral elements was employed to obtain the numerical solution and the segregated formulation was used for solving the equations (Navier-Stokes and energy equations) with SIMPLE algorithm. A comparison with 2D problem data is performed showing a good agreement with 3D case.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: REYNOLDS NUMBER EFFECT ON THE HEAT TRANSFER MECHANISMS IN AIRCRAFT HOT AIR ANTI-ICE

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The primary means of preventing ice formation on wings and engine inlets for modern commercial transport&#10;aircraft is by extracting hot air from the compressor and blowing it on the inside surface of the leading edge through&#10;small holes drilled in the so-called piccolo tube system. A critical aspect in the design of such system is the prediction&#10;of heat transfer of the impinging jets from the piccolo tube. The correct evaluation of the heat transfer rate in such&#10;devices is of great interest to optimize both the anti-icing performance and the hot air bleeding from the high-pressure&#10;compressor. A review of the literature reveals that there are some experimental and numerical studies that developed&#10;correlations for the average Nusselt number. However, most of the research was performed using a single jet or a&#10;group of jets impinging on a flat slat, which is different from the jet impingement on concave surfaces, as the inside&#10;surface of a wing. Therefore, the objective of the present work is use a commercial CFD software to perform a&#10;parametric study of the jet impingement on concave surfaces. The main goal is determine the effect of the Reynolds&#10;number on the heat transfer process. At the end of the work, a correlation for the average Nusselt number which&#10;account for the Reynolds number is presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF PULSATILE BLOOD FLOW IN RIGID CAROTID BIFURCATION

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Hemodynamic simulation studies have been frequently used to gain a better understanding of functional,&#10;diagnostic and therapeutic aspects of the blood flow. Blood can be considered as a pseudoplastic fluid with yield stress&#10;but many factors can influence blood viscosity and its behavior. At the present work, the blood flow in a human carotid&#10;bifurcation is modeled applying the threedimensional, unsteady, incompressible Navier-Stokes equations employing a&#10;power-law viscosity model. The vessel wall is assumed rigid and a periodic velocity condition is imposed at the common&#10;carotid artery (CCA) inlet. The computational 3D domain is discretized using the volume finite method with an&#10;unstructured mesh. Numerical solution is obtained with an implicit transient scheme and the SIMPLE algorithm is&#10;employed for pressure velocity coupling. The influence of the pulsation rate on the fluid flow patterns was studied and&#10;undesirable reverse blood flow regions were also identified.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A CFD ANALYSIS OF HEAT TRANSFER IN A 3D BACKWARD-FACING STEP LAMINAR

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Fluid flows over a backward-facing step with or without heat transfer are often used as benchmark problem&#10;for computational fluid dynamic (CFD) codes. Some features of this flow, such as: recirculation zone extensions,&#10;spanwise swirling vortex and Nusselt number distributions on the heated stepped wall present several challenges to&#10;CFD solutions. In this work, 3D heat and fluid flow in a backward-facing step with aspect ratio of 8 and expansion&#10;ratio of 2 are numerically solved by finite volume technique. A segregated coupling of pressure-velocity is employed&#10;and a mesh sensitivity study is performed. The results presented good agreement compared with numerical and&#10;experimental data from literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A CFD STUDY OF SQUARE PIN FINS AIR-COOLED HEAT SINK

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 12th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Nowadays, finned air-cooled heat sinks are still the most popular means for electronic equipment cooling.&#10;Passive heat sinks are cooled by air natural convection while in the active dissipators the heat is transferred to a&#10;forced convection fan induced air flow. The decrease of the heat dissipation capacity due to the reduction in the heat&#10;exchange area represents a restriction in the evolution of the electronic components compactness. Hence, researches&#10;must be carried out to improve the heat transfer processes simulation and to increase the heat sinks effectiveness. At&#10;the present work, the Reynolds Averaged Navier-Stokes (mass, momentum and energy) and k-e turbulence model&#10;equations are numerically solved employing the finite volume method and a segregated velocity-pressure coupling to&#10;analyze the square pin fins air-cooled heat sinks in a staggered arrangement. A mesh sensitivity study and a&#10;comparison with experimental results were performed to validate the numerical procedure. Pressure drop and heat&#10;transfer coefficient were obtained to evaluate the heat sink performance as a function of the frontal velocity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: OUTFLOW DUCT LENGTH EFFECT IN A SUDDEN EXPANSION HIGH REYNOLDS LAMINAR FLOW

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XXIX Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. The separated flows generated by a sudden expansion channel have interesting&#10;characteristics. They are produced by an abrupt change in geometry and have great&#10;importance in many engineering applications, such as flow in diffusers, airfoils with&#10;separation, flow around buildings, combustors, turbines blades, and many flow-relevant&#10;systems. Also, the flow over a backward-facing step is a widely known benchmark problem,&#10;which is used to evaluate the ability of computational fluid dynamics program accuracy to&#10;predict the separated flow behavior. Numerical simulations of laminar flow over a twodimensional&#10;backward-facing step are reported to investigate the influence of the outlet&#10;duct length on recirculation regions downstream of the step. The domain of this work was&#10;based on mid-plane dimensions of Armaly et al (1983) with expansion ratio H/h=1.9423.&#10;The simulations were carried out for Reynolds numbers 800 and 1,000. The mathematical&#10;modeling equations (mass conservation and momentum) were solved by the finite volume&#10;method (FVM) with a segregated approach. A mesh refinement study is performed to&#10;attain the grid independence requirement. Two outflow channel lengths are analyzed. The&#10;numerical results were compared to experimental and numerical data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Academic Works Using CFD Commercial Codes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2008 ESSS South American ANSYS Users Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2008 ESSS South American ANSYS Users Conference

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: this work presents an overview of academic works developed by GSET group (Grupo de Simulação de Escomento e Transferência de Calor) placed at ITA (Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica), São Paulo, Brazil. The GSET facilities are shown and typical problems related to aircraft environmental control systems are discussed (air conditioning ductwork balancing, fire suppression, drain jet, cabin smoke transport, etc.). The main objective is to show that the CFD tool can be extremely useful during the preliminary design of these systems saving cost and time consumptions attributed to experimental tests. Firstly, some validated studies are described showing good agreement with theoretical and/or experimental results. Then, the CFD predictive feature was explored and more realistic problems were simulated (e.g., aircraft fuel tank sloshing, cabin air circulation, bleed hot-air anti-ice system). Results showed that to attain good solutions, the commercial code must be handled carefully requiring a level-headed and well instructed user.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Experimental and Numerical Investigation of Roughness and Three-dimensional Effects on the Flow over Shallow Cavities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 39th AIAA Fluid Dynamics Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 39th AIAA Fluid Dynamics Conference

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Fico Jr

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper is aimed at investigating the cavity roughness surface condition and threedimensional effects, originated due to cavity spanwise finite dimension, on the flow pattern. Results of the flow topology obtained with roughness added (using sand paper) on the whole cavity surface and with roughness just in the entrance region were compared. The data showed that the flow topologies in these situations are not very similar. Two-dimensional PIV measurements have been conducted at several planes, parallel to the main flow direction, in order to find out the distance from the middle of the cavity where the threedimensional effects start to be relevant. Fixed cavity geometry and two values of Reynolds number were considered. With the purpose of investigating more deeply the threedimensional effects, a numerical study taking into account the constructive aspects of cavity model has been started. Some numerical results for the case of two-dimensional cavity with smooth surface will be presented. A good agreement between numerical and experimental results was observed. The numerical investigation of three-dimensional effects will be reported in future works.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A CFD Analysis of the Fire Suppression System Inside an Aircraft Cargo Compartment

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 39th AIAA Fluid Dynamic Conference
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Accepted for publication

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract&#10;Commercial aircrafts must have a fire suppression system in the cargo compartment to&#10;satisfy the safety and certification requirements. These fire extinguishing systems are based&#10;on a gas discharge that performs a physicochemical inhibition of the combustion reaction.&#10;Most system uses Halon 1301 as the fire extinguishing agent which is stored in liquid phase&#10;within one or two bottles. As the fire is detected, the fire suppressant agent is discharged in&#10;the cargo compartment with a Halon volumetric concentration higher than 5 % for fire&#10;knockdown in the initial stage. In the next stage, the Halon volumetric concentration should&#10;be maintained above the inerting level (3 %). At this work, the halon volumetric&#10;concentration was obtained applying a CFD code in which the governing equations (mass,&#10;momentum, species transport and turbulence model) are numerically solved. This&#10;methodology allows determining the transient behavior of the following parameters: Halon&#10;volumetric concentration, Halon and air masses and the cargo compartment internal&#10;pressure. Comparison between numerical and experimental data for the halon volumetric&#10;concentration time-evolution inside the cargo compartment showed good agreement. This&#10;numerical simulation provides a reliable tool to predict the fire extinguishing system&#10;behavior and to adjust the design parameters to satisfy the certification requirements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Thermodynamic Study of Aircraft Air Conditioning Air Cycle Machines: 3-Wheel X 4-Wheel

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;The main objective of this report is the development of aeronautic air conditioning system thermodynamic&#10;models of 3 and 4-wheel air cycle machines, aiming to understand the main thermodynamic advantages and&#10;disadvantages of each configuration. The EES  Equation Engineering Solver is used to develop the models, some&#10;parametric analysis and the graphic outputs. Ones intention also is to evaluate the impacts of the re-heaters and&#10;condensers in the system efficiency. The thermodynamic models are tested under ground and flight operational&#10;conditions. Results showed that the second level of expansion from 4-wheel air cycle machine increases the&#10;thermodynamic efficiency of the cycle, and this effect was more evident for ground operation conditions. In addition, it&#10;was observed that the presence of a condenser decreases the coefficient of performance of both air cycle machines&#10;discussed, which is related to the fact that lines of constant pressure on a T-s diagram diverge with increasing entropy.&#10;Ones concluded that the application of the software EES for thermodynamic analysis of air cycle machines can be&#10;really useful for advanced design analysis, mainly because it helps in understanding the thermodynamic process&#10;considered.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: CFD Adjusted One-Dimensional Jet Pump Model

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This work deals with the numerical simulation of an isothermal fluid flow in an axisymmetric jet pump using&#10;a CFD tool. Considering an incompressible constant properties turbulent flow, the numerical solution was obtained&#10;applying a segregated approach with finite volume discretization of the governing equations. The one-dimensional loss&#10;coefficients were evaluated using the numerical results. The one-dimensional jet pump model results were compared&#10;with experimental results for suction flow rate, head ratios and efficiencies. This adjusted one-dimensional model is&#10;important to the preliminary design of the jet pump.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Sistemas de Controle Ambiental do Avião

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Impingement jets have been widely used in several engineering applications to heat and/or cool surfaces. Some practical&#10;examples include: the paper drying, cooling of electrical equipments, tempering and shaping of glass, annealing of metal and&#10;plastic sheets, high-temperature gas turbine blades. In aviation the impingement jet is used in anti-icing systems on leading edge of&#10;aircraft wing, using hot air extracted of the propulsion turbine motor (bleed air). In the literature there is many works concerning to&#10;the heat transfer correlations for impingement jets in flat plates and concave or convex surfaces. At the present work, a critical&#10;review of some correlations available will be performed to verify theirs applicability to the aircraft anti-icing preliminary design. It&#10;was verified that none of the Nusselt number correlations analyzed could be applied to the piccolo tube anti-icing system with&#10;suitable reliability.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: NUMERICAL STUDY OF THE APPLICATION OF V2F TURBULENCE MODEL IN AXISYMMETRIC IMPINGEMENT JET

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Jet impingement cooling has been widely used to cool elements exposed to high temperature and high heat flux&#10;environments because of its advantages in the effective removal of locally concentrated heat and the easy adjustment to the location&#10;where the cooling is needed. A numerical investigation was performed to predict thermal characteristics in the axisymmetrical&#10;turbulent jet impinging on a flat surface. The problem considered is circular jet airflow (Prandtl number equal to 0.71) impinging&#10;onto hot flat plate with Reynolds number equal to 23,000. At this work, a numerical study applying segregated control volume&#10;numerical scheme is carried out to analyze the jet impinging normally on the flat plate. The computations were performed using the&#10;normal velocity relaxation turbulence model (V2F model) implemented in the commercial CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamic)&#10;software. The focus of this work is an analysis of the procedures for mesh generation to attain the range of Yplus values in the&#10;impingement wall recommended for V2F turbulence model. For validation, the computational Nusselt number results have been&#10;compared with experimental data and presented a good agreement.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;Blood flow numerical simulation has been undertaken to attain a better understanding of functional, diagnostic and therapeutic aspects of the blood flow. Blood can be considered as a pseudoplastic fluid with yield stress but many factors can influence blood viscosity and its behavior. The study of blood flow through stenosed human arteries is very important because of the fact that the cause and development of many arterial diseases leading to the malfunction of the cardiovascular system. At the present work, the blood flow in a stenosed artery is modeled applying the threedimensional, unsteady, incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. The vessel wall is assumed rigid under a constant temperature and a uniform temperature is applied at the inlet boundary. The computational 3D domain is discretized using the finite volume method with an unstructured mesh. Numerical solution is obtained with an implicit transient scheme and the SIMPLE algorithm is employed for pressure velocity coupling. The influence of the Wormersley number on the fluid flow patterns was studied and the reverse flow regions were also identified.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ESTUDO NUMÉRICO DO DESEMPENHO DE UM DISPOSITIVO DE VENTILAÇÃO BASEADO EM ASA DELTA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo:&#10;Neste trabalho é feito um estudo numérico do desempenho de um dispositivo de ventilação baseado em uma asa delta. O dispositivo consiste de uma associação entre um tubo exaustor e uma asa delta em alto ângulo de ataque que, na presença de vento, gera uma região de baixa pressão que força a exaustão de ar do interior de um ambiente fechado. Foi utilizado um programa comercial de CFD para simular o escoamento, considerado incompressível e em regime permanente, no equacionamento RANS, prevendo o funcionamento e o desempenho do dispositivo. Os resultados são comparados com resultados experimentais obtidos da literatura, apresentando concordância satisfatória, especialmente em baixos números de Reynolds.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: CFD Study of Steam Condensing Flow in a Laval Nozzle

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIII Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of 13rd Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. &#10;The process of condensing steam inside turbines damage their internal surfaces and also reduces the aerodynamic efficiency in that region. As a frame for study of the condensation in turbine stages, it is proposed in this paper a simpler case, having the wet steam flow set in a 2D transonic Laval nozzle (convergent-divergent). This geometry is selected due to possibility to validate the CFD code on the basis of experimental data for Laval nozzles. The goal is to investigate how the variation of the thermal parameters, such as temperature and pressure, changes the condensation onset by examining the region of nucleation and growth of steam droplets along the flow direction. The condensation phenomena is modeled on the basis of the classical nucleation theory. In this work, the mathematical model of this multiphase compressible flow is numerically solved using finite volume method with a coupled density-based approach. Turbulence models were used in the numerical simulations as comparation with the experimental available data. The simulation results shows that for avoiding condensation inside the nozzle must consider the possibility of elevating the temperature of steam at the entrance or decreasing the pressure difference established between the input and output.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 6th National Congress of Mechanical Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: No desenvolvimento de uma nova aeronave, o fabricante busca atingir desempenhos melhores, para que a&#10;mesma seja mais competitiva, tendo bons resultados operacionais. Devido a influência do ar condicionado no&#10;desempenho da aeronave, o fabricante buscará melhorar o rendimento de ciclo de ar condicionado, através da&#10;melhoria de alguns processos do ciclo. Com o objetivo de medir a influência dos rendimentos de cada processo no&#10;resultado final do ciclo, desenvolveu-se uma ferramenta/modelo para facilitar o cálculo dos ciclos simples, bootstrap e&#10;misto, tornando fácil e rápida a variação dos dados de entrada e a obtenção dos resultados finais. Através desta&#10;ferramenta foram analisados os efeitos das variações dos parâmetros de voo e de cabine, variação da porção de&#10;potência destinada ao compressor secundário, variação dos rendimentos de cada processo no desempenho final do&#10;ciclo e, além disso, foi analisado como o desempenho do ciclo se comporta numa missão típica de uma aeronave&#10;comercial. Os resultados mostram que o ciclo bootstrap é o que apresenta os melhores coeficientes de desempenho,&#10;que o rendimento do compressor do motor, apesar do mesmo não fazer parte da máquina de ar condicionado, é o que&#10;tem a maior influência no resultado do ciclo, e que o coeficiente de desempenho apresenta grande variação com a&#10;altitude, devido a queda da temperatura ambiente, apresentando resultado divergente do coeficiente de desempenho&#10;quando levado em consideração a potência de pressurização, devido à grande queda de pressão.

The study of blood flow through stenosed human arteries is very important because of the fact that the cause and development of many arterial diseases leading to the malfunction of the cardiovascular system. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. This work presents a methodology applied to modeling and simulation of an aeronautical air conditioning&#10;simple Air Cycle Machine (ACM). Using Matlab/Simulink tools, an ACM was modeled and the model was evaluated&#10;comparing the results with available experimental data.The model is able to represent the ACM operating in open and&#10;closed control loop (with ACM outlet air temperature control).For the model construction, the ACM was separated in&#10;its several components and specific models were built for each one (turbine, fan, heat exchanger, temperature control&#10;valve and controller). The components models were integrated, in order to represent the ACM and simulations were&#10;run exposing the model to several inlet pressure and temperature conditions.During simulations the air was taken as&#10;dry, therefore it was not modeled the ACMs water separator component.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Numerical study of three recirculation zones in the unilateral sudden expansion flow?

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Communications in Heat and Mass Transfer

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: ZAPAROLI, E. L.;ZAPAROLI, E;Zaparoli, Edson Luiz;ZAPAROLI, EDSON L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract:&#10;Numerical simulations of the two-dimensional laminar flow over a backward-facing step channel using two commercially-available Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) code are reported. The subject is to analyze the three recirculation regions of the flow in a unilateral sudden expansion. Results are presented for laminar air flow for Reynolds number lower than 2500. The mathematical model equations (mass conservation and momentum) were solved with finite element (FEM) and finite volume (FVM) methods and a segregated approach. To get the grid independent, intensive refinement studies were carried out. Results obtained are compared to experimental data presenting a good agreement. The numerical results of this work show a non-linear increase of the reattachment length as also shown by the experimental results extracted from&#10;literature.
